variant.name: .FasterThanInflation
variant.summary: This histogram reports just those timings that were faster than inflation.

variant.name: .SlowerThanInflation
variant.summary: This histogram reports just those timings that were slower than inflation.

histogram.name: Mobile.AppMenu.HighlightMenuItem.Clicked
histogram.summary: Records which menu item was clicked when a user clicks on a menu item from the app menu that was highlighted. Android only.

histogram.name: Mobile.AppMenu.HighlightMenuItem.Shown
histogram.summary: Records which menu item was highlighted when the app menu was opened by the user. Android only.

histogram.name: Mobile.AppMenu.SimilarSelection
histogram.summary: Android: This metrics is recorded when users made similar selections on app menu within a period of time. ex. a user selected downloading the current page. After 5 seconds, the user opened the app menu again and selected download manager. In this case, we would consider that Download and Download Manager are similar selections.

histogram.name: Mobile.AppMenu.TimeToTakeAction.Abandoned
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the user to abandon the app menu after it's shown by pressing back or touching outside the menu. This is only logged if the menu is abandoned. See Mobile.AppMenu.TimeToTakeAction.SelectedItem for the cases where it is closed as a result of user interaction with the menu. Android only.

histogram.name: Mobile.AppMenu.TimeToTakeAction.SelectedItem
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the user to select an item. This is only logged if the menu is closed as a result of the user clicking a menu item. See Mobile.AppMenu.TimeToTakeAction.Abandoned for the cases where it is abandoned by the user. Android only.

histogram.name: Mobile.CanonicalURLResult
histogram.summary: The result of the operation to retrieve the page's canonical URL.

histogram.name: Mobile.ContextMenu.EntryPoints
histogram.summary: Tracks which context menu was shown. To drill down into a specific context menu's usage, take a look at its actions' histogram (the format for actions histograms is Mobile.ContextMenu.*.Actions). Currently only on iOS.

histogram.name: Mobile.ContextMenu.{EntryPoint}.Actions
histogram.summary: Tracks which action was selected in the context menu shown for a {EntryPoint}. To view how often this context menu was shown, take a look at this other histogram: Mobile.ContextMenu.EntryPoints. Currently only on iOS.

histogram.name: Mobile.DefaultBrowser.BrowserCount
histogram.summary: Android: The number of browsers installed on the device. Logged when a new session is started.

histogram.name: Mobile.DefaultBrowser.State
histogram.summary: Android: Whether or not the device has a default browser and whether or not it is a system installed browser. Logged when a new session is started.

histogram.name: Mobile.DefaultBrowser.SystemBrowserCount
histogram.summary: Android: The number of system installed browsers. Logged when a new session is started.

histogram.name: Mobile.Legacy.Translate.Toggle.Delay
histogram.summary: Records the time between tapping the target and source language in a legacy infobar. If only one of either is tapped, nothing is logged.

histogram.name: Mobile.Legacy.Translate.Unused.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the time an unused legacy infobar persists on screen. This is logged when the infobar is closed.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Badge.Tapped
histogram.summary: Records the state of a badge when it was tapped.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Banner.Dismiss
histogram.summary: Records the reason why a Banner was dismissed.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Banner.Event
histogram.summary: Records Infobar Banner events.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Banner.OnScreenTime
histogram.summary: Records the time an Infobar (Messages) Banner is visible on screen. Used to know how long it takes a user to act on the banner before it gets auto-dismissed.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.ConcurrentPresented
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of multiple Infobars being presented at the same time. This will be recorded everytime an Infobar is presented.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Confirm.Accept.Time
histogram.summary: Records the time between the Infobar Delegate is created, and the user accepts a Confirm Infobar action.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Confirm.Event
histogram.summary: Records the events related to Confirm Infobars (e.g. Presented, Accepted, Dismissed,etc.)

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Modal.Event
histogram.summary: Records generic Infobar Modal events.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.OverflowRow.Tapped
histogram.summary: Records a tap on an Infobar overflow menu row.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Passwords.Modal.Dismiss
histogram.summary: Records the reason why a Password Modal was dismissed.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Passwords.Modal.Event
histogram.summary: Records Password specific Infobar Modal events.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Passwords.Modal.Present
histogram.summary: Records the context when a Password Modal was presented.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Save.Card.Modal.Event
histogram.summary: Records Save Card specific Infobar Modal events.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Translate.Banner.Event
histogram.summary: Records the context when an iOS user taps on a Translate Banner Action Button.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Translate.Modal.Event
histogram.summary: Records when an iOS user initiates an Translate specific Infobar Modal event.

histogram.name: Mobile.Messages.Translate.Modal.Present
histogram.summary: Records the context when an iOS user initiates a Translate Modal presentation.

histogram.name: Mobile.RecentTabsManager.TotalTabsFromOtherDevicesOpenAll
histogram.summary: Records the total number of tabs opened when Open all was selected from other devices in Recent Tabs.

histogram.name: Mobile.Share.EntryPoints
histogram.summary: Tracks which sharing entry point was triggered. To view the outcome of these sharing scenarios, take a look at their actions' histogram (the format is Mobile.Share.*.Actions). Currently only on iOS.

histogram.name: Mobile.Share.{EntryPoint}.Actions
Mobile.SystemNotification.Action.Click
histogram.summary: Records which Android notifications users interact with. Recorded when an user taps the button in a notification, for any Chrome-generated notification on Android that includes a button tap-target.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Action.Click.Age
histogram.summary: Records the duration in minutes from the time when the system notification is shown to the time that the user clicked on an action button on the Android notification.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Blocked
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the number of system notifications that were blocked and could not be shown by type.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.BlockedAfterShown
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the type of notification that was last shown before the user disabled notification permissions on Chrome. This is only logged the first time we attempt to show a notification and fail.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.ChannelBlocked
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the number of system notifications by type that we attempted to show but were blocked, due to their notification channel being blocked. Only applies to devices on Android O and above.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Content.Click
histogram.summary:
Records the type of notification when the user clicks the body of Android notification. This does not include clicks on notification action buttons.
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Content.Click.Age
histogram.summary: Records the duration in minutes from the time when the system notification is shown to the time that the user clicked the notification on Android.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Dismiss
histogram.summary: Records the type of notification when the user dismisses the Android notification.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Dismiss.Age
histogram.summary: Records the duration in minutes from the time when the system notification is shown to the time that the user dismissed the notification on Android.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.NotifyFailure
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the number of system notifications failed to be notified by Android NotificationManager API. Recorded when the notification is shown on Android.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.Shown
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the number of system notifications that will be successfully shown to the user by type.

histogram.name: Mobile.Translate.Unused.Count
histogram.summary: Records a histogram for an infobar (both legacy and Messages) that the user did not interact with throughout its lifetime.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Background
histogram.summary: Android: Records events for downloads started from the background, that is, while the browser process is not running. Used to measure completion rate of these downloads.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Background.TargetDeterminationResult
histogram.summary: Android: Records the target determination result for downloads started in the background, that is, while the browser process is not running.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.ContextMenu.SaveImage
histogram.summary: Android: Records various counts related to the save image context menu option.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.DownloadLaterPromptStatus
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether download later dialog will be shown to the user. Recorded when the download later preference is initialized in native.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.DownloadPromptStatus
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether download dialog will be shown to the user. Recorded when the download preference is initialized in native.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Location.Dialog.DirectoryType
histogram.summary: Records the directory type when the user selects the download directory through download location dialog. May be recorded even when the user didn't download anything.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Location.Dialog.Result
histogram.summary: Records whether the user accepted or dismissed the dialog to select a download location.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Location.Dialog.Suggestion.Events
histogram.summary: Records the download location suggestion event.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Location.Dialog.SuggestionSelected
histogram.summary: Records the download location suggestion choice.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Location.Dialog.Type
histogram.summary: Records the download location dialog type when the dialog is shown to the user.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Location.DirectoryType
histogram.summary: Records the directory type shown when a user opens download location dialog or download location setting. This is recorded when the directory provider generates a list of available directories.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Location.Download.DirectoryType
histogram.summary: Records the directory type when download is completed.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Location.Setting.DirectoryType
histogram.summary: Records the directory type when the user selects the download directory through download preference. May be recorded even when the user didn't download anything.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.ResumptionsCount
histogram.summary: Android: Records the number of resumptions for a download by resumption type. For all resumption types, this is recorded when a download is finished, completed or cancelled. For automatic resumptions, it is also recorded when user manually resumes the download to clear the auto retry count.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.StoragePermission
histogram.summary: Android: Records various counts when requesting the storage permission.

histogram.name: MobileFre.CctTos.EnterprisePolicyCheckSpeed2{MobileFreInflationSpeedComparison}
histogram.summary: Android: Records the time it takes from ToS fragment attached to the activity to the enterprise policy check completing. This check is often skipped when its result becomes irrelevant. {MobileFreInflationSpeedComparison}

histogram.name: MobileFre.CctTos.EnterprisePolicyCheckSpeed{MobileFreInflationSpeedComparison}
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated and replaced with MobileFre.CctTos.EnterprisePolicyCheckSpeed2.*. as of 11/2020. The starting time of this metrics is changed to when the fragment attached to the FirstRunActivity.
histogram.summary: Android: Records the time it takes from object initialization to the enterprise policy check completing. This check is often skipped when its result becomes irrelevant. Histogram has suffixes depending if the timing was faster or slower than inflation.

histogram.name: MobileFre.CctTos.IsDeviceOwnedCheckSpeed2{MobileFreInflationSpeedComparison}
MobileFre.CctTos.IsDeviceOwnedCheckSpeed{MobileFreInflationSpeedComparison}
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated and replaced with MobileFre.CctTos.IsDeviceOwnedCheckSpeed2.*. as of 11/2020. The starting time of this metrics is changed to when the fragment attached to the FirstRunActivity.
histogram.summary: Android: Records the time it takes from object initialization to the device ownership check completing. Histogram has suffixes depending if the timing was faster or slower than inflation.

histogram.name: MobileFre.CctTos.LoadingDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Records how long it takes to load the enterprise CCT/ToS fragment.

histogram.name: MobileFre.ChildAccountStatusDuration
histogram.summary: Android: The amount of time spent fetching child account status during the FRE. Not applicable for light weight FRE.

histogram.name: MobileFre.FragmentInflationSpeed
histogram.summary: Android: Enterprise FRE cannot fully show the first page until the appRestrictions call returns. This suffixed histogram measures when fragment inflation was slower or faster than the appRestrictions call, and wether the UI had to wait. Note this is recorded for all clients, not just enterprise. Not applicable for light weight FRE.

histogram.name: MobileFre.FromLaunch
histogram.summary: Android: This suffixed histogram represents the amount of time from when the FRE intent was initially constructed, until some event in the future occurs. Not applicable for light weight FRE.

histogram.name: MobileFre.Lightweight.EnterprisePolicyCheckSpeed{MobileFreInflationSpeedComparison}
MobileFre.Lightweight.IsDeviceOwnedCheckSpeed{MobileFreInflationSpeedComparison}
MobileFre.Lightweight.LoadingDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Records how long it takes waiting from the dialog for Lightweight FRE created to content fully loaded - either ToS is shown or FRE is skipped.

histogram.name: MobileFre.NativeInitialized
histogram.summary: Android: The amount of time spent between FRE started and native initialization. Recorded when native is fully initialized.

histogram.name: MobileFre.PolicyServiceInitDelayAfterNative{PolicyPresence}
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by MobileFre.PolicyServiceInitDelayAfterNative.*2 due to bug fix as of 05/2021. See https://crbug.com/1208942.
histogram.summary: Android: The amount of time spent between native initialized and the decision "whether we need to wait to load policy service from native" has been made. The decision is made when no on-device policy is found, or policy service is fully initialized. If the decision has been made before native initialization, SystemClock#elapsedRealTime was recorded, in which does not provide much useful information. Recorded during FRE only, when on-device policy is {PolicyPresence}

histogram.name: MobileFre.PolicyServiceInitDelayAfterNative{PolicyPresence}2
histogram.summary: Android: The amount of time spent between native initialized and the decision "whether we need to wait to load policy service from native" has been made. The decision is made when no on-device policy is found, or policy service is fully initialized. If the decision has been made before native initialization, it will not be recorded. Recorded during FRE only, when on-device policy is {PolicyPresence}

histogram.name: MobileFre.Progress
histogram.summary: Android: Records which states of the "first run experience" have been reached. Each bucket represents a state and recorded everytime the state changed. Pages can be double counted if the user goes backwards in the flow.

histogram.name: MobileFre.SignInChoice
histogram.summary: Android: How the user left the sign-in part of the "first run experience" activity (M-38+).

histogram.name: MobileFre.TosFragment.SpinnerVisibleDuration
histogram.summary: Android: The amount of time that the small spinner, which become visible after the ToS is accepted, is showing on screen.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.DurationAfterPotraitRotation
histogram.summary: Android: Records the duration that a fullscreen video is played after device rotates from portrait to landscape mode for the first time, and before it exits fullscreen. If there is no device rotation or if the video starts with landscape mode, it is not recorded. If there are mutiple rotations between portrait and landscape mode, only one record is emitted and it is equal to the time period from the first rotation to the moment when the video exits fullscreen.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.LandscapeDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Records the duration that a fullscreen video is played in landscape mode. If a video starts playing in landscape mode, and then it is switched back and forth between landscape and portrait mode, only the time period before the first switch is accounted. If a video starts playing in portrait mode, it is not recorded.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.LandscapeRotation
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether a fullscreen video is switched from landscape to portrait mode at any point during playback.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.OrientationPortrait
histogram.summary: Android: Records the device orientation when a video enters fullscreen. The value is true if device orientation is portrait, or false otherwise. The video doesn't necessarily needs to be in a playing state.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.PortraitDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Records the duration that a fullscreen video is played in portrait mode. If a video starts playing in portrait mode, and then it is switched back and forth between landscape and portrait mode, only the time period before the first switch is accounted. If a video starts playing in landscape mode, it is not recorded.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.PortraitRotation
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether a fullscreen video is switched from portrait to landscape mode at any point during playback.

histogram.name: MobileFullscreenVideo.VideoPortrait
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether a video has a larger height than width when it enters the fullscreen mode.

histogram.name: MobileIntent.FirstPartyToInternalScheme
histogram.summary: Recorded when Chrome on Android is launched to an internal Chrome scheme (chrome://, chrome-native://, about://) by a first party app (not Chrome). This metric is to be used to determine whether any first party app uses the feature, and whether we can remove it.

histogram.name: MobileIntent.PageLoadDueToExternalApp
histogram.summary: Android: Count of page loads started by intents from external apps. In M87 the reporting of this histogram was updated to exclude intents sent from Chrome itself.

histogram.name: MobileOmnibox.LongPressPasteAge
histogram.summary:
Recorded when user long presses and pastes clipboard content into omnibox. The value indicates the estimated age of the clipboard.
Intended to be compared to Omnibox.ClipboardSuggestionShownAge.

histogram.name: MobileOmnibox.PopupOpenDuration
histogram.summary: Recorded when the omnibox popup is closed. Indicates the duration it was open.

histogram.name: MobileOmnibox.PressedClipboardSuggestionAge
histogram.summary:
When a user presses an omnibox suggestion based on the content of the clipboard, this histograms records how long ago Chrome detected a change in the clipboard.
Intended to be compared to Omnibox.ClipboardSuggestionShownAge.
If Chrome never detected a change to the clipboard, no clipboard suggestion is shown, meaning this histogram will never be emitted to.

histogram.name: MobileSignInPromo.BookmarkManager.ImpressionsTilDismiss
histogram.summary: Counts how many times the signin promo is implicitly dismissed (by closing the bookmark manager) per impression.

histogram.name: MobileSignInPromo.BookmarkManager.ImpressionsTilSigninButtons
histogram.summary: Counts how many times one of the "sign in" buttons (any of the signed-out "Sign in to Chrome" button, the "Continue as |name|" button, or the "Not |email|?" button) is clicked per impression.

histogram.name: MobileSignInPromo.BookmarkManager.ImpressionsTilXButton
histogram.summary: Counts how many times the explicit "X"-to-close button is clicked per impression.

histogram.name: MobileSignInPromo.NTPContentSuggestions.ImpressionsTilXButton
histogram.summary: Counts how many times the explicit "X"-to-close button is clicked per impression. Recorded when the signin promo is dismissed using the "X".

histogram.name: MobileSignInPromo.SettingsManager.ImpressionsTilDismiss
histogram.summary: Counts how many times the signin promo is implicitly dismissed (by closing the settings view) per impression.

histogram.name: MobileSignInPromo.SettingsManager.ImpressionsTilSigninButtons
histogram.summary: Counts how many times one of the "sign in" buttons (any of the signed-out "Sign in to Chrome" button, the "Continue as |name|" button, or the "Not |email|?" button) is clicked per impression.

histogram.name: MobileSignInPromo.SettingsManager.ImpressionsTilXButton
histogram.summary: Counts how many times the explicit "X"-to-close button is clicked per impression.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.DailyLaunchCount
histogram.summary:
Android only.
The number of times the tabbed mode of Chrome is launched within a given 24 hour window. Recall that custom tabs is not considered tabbed mode. A "launch" here is defined as anytime the tabbed mode is made visible (foregrounded), but all Chrome activities must be completely hidden before we'll count an additional launch. It includes all kinds of intents, such as MAIN and VIEW. By ensuring all Chrome activities are hidden, we avoid overcounting by going to Settings and returning to Chrome.
This launch definition includes some items one might not expect: (i) click a link in Chrome that opens in another app, then click back. (ii) have Chrome in the foreground, then the screen times out (goes blank) or engages the lock screen, then wake up/unlock the device. (iii) switch to "Recents", then re-select Chrome. In all these cases, Chrome has gone to the background so returning to it counts as another launch.
The value reported reflects activity over a 24-hour window in the past, possibly the distant past. Reporting is controlled by storing an initial launch timestamp and counting all "launches" as a count until a new launch happens after the 24hr window has elapsed (at this point, a new 24hr window is started). The count is reported at the start of the next 24hr window, so this is a retroactive count. For example, if a user uses Chrome in one day two months ago, then doesn't use Chrome at all, then when Chrome launches today it'll report the value during that 24-hour window.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.Experimental.LaunchCause
histogram.summary:
Records what caused Chrome to be launched.
Recorded for all types of ChromeActivity, in all cases where Chrome becomes visible to the user.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.IntentToCreationTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes from creating an intent for ChromeActivity to activity creation. This includes activity creation time spent in the framework.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.LaunchCause
histogram.summary:
Records what caused Chrome to be launched.
Recorded for all types of ChromeActivity, in all cases where Chrome becomes visible to the user, or intentionally transitions between Chrome Activities.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.LaunchType
histogram.summary:
The type of launching Chrome mobile app, e.g launch by hitting icon.
Only recorded for tabbed mode launches of Chrome. Recall that custom tabs is not considered tabbed mode.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarInflationTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time spent performing toolbar layout inflation.
